values:
Sunday:
 A day for realxing around my house. I remember when I was younger that my grandma and grandpa would always tell me not to work on Sundays. They would sit on the porch and people would drop by and visit them off and on all day long.
Well, things are different now. Grandpa has passed and Grandma is in the nursing home, but, I still take their advice for Sundays being my day to relax . However now that I am a wife and mother, I find that "realxing" consists of catching up on laundry and house celaning. I make sure to play with the babies and spend at least an hour on our front porch.
 Sunday dinner varies, but we like to have a good old "country" dinner consisting of fried chicken,mashed potatoes and gravy,green beans,corn,home-made biscuits, and a few deserts.
So- this leads me to a question:
What is your idea of a good old "Sunday Supper"?

well, I will run for now, but will be back soon.
Love,
Sally

Today is going wonderful. Our oldest daughter ffrom Florida and her husband are up. She will be having her first baby sometime this month and we are getting ready to go shopping and out to lunch.
 It is funny how having a baby can bring you so much closer together. Before this, I never really had anything in common with her, but this visit I feel like we have gotten closer and finally have something that we can both relate to. Sometimes it is just nice to talk to someone who has been through some of the same things that you have ya know?
 I hope that your weekend was great. I do have some wonderful ideas in store and plan on catching you in chat tonight if you are in there.
My Love,
Sally

Wednesday: Almost half way through another week. I have plans for a little get away that I am looking forward to this weekend. We plan on going to Gatlinburg Tennessee for a couple of days to meet up with some of our friends. I will be sure to get you some pictures while I am there okay?
 If  you can think of something that you would like for me to try to do for you drop me an e-mail before Friday and I'll try and get it for ya over the weekend.
I hope the weather stays nice for it.
Please take care ,
Xo Xo Xo
Sally

I hope that your weekend went as well as mine did.
 This past weekend we had a "DreamNet Barmeet" here in Atlanta. It was so wonderful to actually meet some of the people who support me here on my little site. Everyone was so nice and sweet!
It was a new experience for me and I had a wonderful, wonderful time. I also got to meet some of the Dream girls from some other areas too and they were all so beautiful and nice too! I realized that here on DreamNet my "co workers" and "bosses" are all very very wonderful people.
I also found out that the MAIN priority is YOU. Yes You. I mean- I always sort of knew that before, but they spoke so highly of you all and said that you were very faithful and loyal.
With learning this I feel like I need to tell you that my site will take somewhat of a turn.You may or may not like this turn. 
You see-
I have always LOVED fetish work.
feet
wet and messy
boots
heels
hair washing
showering
smoking
pissing
boobs
upskirt shots
catfighting
jeans
jeans ripping
clothes shredding
panythose

...whatever... YOU basically tell me that you want. 
You know- something that might seem a little odd to others. Like if you find a womans feet turn you on SO much that you could almost explode when you look at them long enough...things like that.
So- with this I must ask you:
WHAT (MY DEAR) IS YOUR FETISH AND WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE
Let me know. Don't be shy. Your name will not come up UNLESS you want it to! 
Want me to dedicate an update just to you? Just let me know!!!
Please e-mail me and let's see what we we can cum up with together.
hugs and kisses,
Sally
.......................................................................................................
BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THIS WEEKS UPDATE WITH 30 PICTURES AND A HUGE AND GREAT CATFIGHT VIDEO OF ME AND SUMMER LYNN BEATING THE SHIT OUT OF EACH OTHER!!! WE SCRATCH,BITE,SCREAM AND SHE RIPS MY JEANS OFF!
YOU GOTTA SEE THIS!

What a beautiful day it is on this Tuesday morning.
It is also one day closer to me getting to meet my little DreamNet family too. I can hardly wait!
Did anyone else do anything major this past weekend?
Not much to do in this little sleepy town I am in today. Just need to runto the bank and get a few groceries!
Just wanted to pop in and give a little hello!
Hope your day is great!
Sally




http://i22.photobucket.com/albums/b319/BuddahSC2/81617cd0.jpg
p.s.
What do YOU think of this kind of update? Are you a messy man or not?

Well, here we are ...Friday at last! This week has been a good week except for Wednesday evening.
You see- we have two family doggies that all three of our children love very much. A teacup poodle and a min pin .
Wednesday evening we got a knock at the door saying that someone had ran over our little dog named Bo. We ran out and found him dead in the street.
We live right in town and the speed limit is 25 because of the schools. Someone had to be going faster than that in order to kill him.
What bothers me so much is that they didn't even stop to tell us.
Other than that our week has been another good week. We got more accomplished on our sunroom and I will be ready to post a picture soon.
The weather has been wonderful and hopefully will stay that way:)
Happy Friday to you:)
hugs
Sally
The forecast says that it is supposed to rain for days now! What about my yard work? Am I the only woman who actually enjoys cutting her grass by the way????

Good morning. Here we are yet another fine Monday morning. 
 We have another long week ahead of us. For me and my family it will mean more work on that studio we are finishing up.We insulated, and put up some beautiful white pine wood all day Saturday.
When we finally get it finished I want to post a before and after picture on here for you to see. I know one thing: we are working our asses off on it. That is part of the reason that I have not had as much time to hang out in the chat room. Believe me- it isn't because I don't want to. I just have to get some more work done on this house!
Well, just wanted to give everyone a hello and say that I hope your day and week go wonderfully!!!
My love,
Sally

well...I had the cutest little cartoon that I wanted to post on here for you, but, this darn thing isn't cooperating with me!
Do you know who Maxine is? You know the old lady on the greeting cards? It shows her and the caption reads:
LIFE IS ALL ABOUT ASS;
YOU'RE EITHER COVERING IT
LAUGHING IT OFF
KISSING IT
KICKING IT
BUSTING IT
TRYING TO GET A PIECE OF IT
BEHAVING LIKE ONE
OR YOU LIVE WITH ONE"
...Happy Wednesday guys...we're half way through!!!!

Here we are...another Monday morning. My children are home for spring break, we have our grandchild over and each child has a friend....let's add that up...oh yes- and my 2 year old.....
that would be 7 kids.....NERVE PILLS ANYONE??????
 I plan on doing a "pissing" video for my quick pic set because I have had so many people asking for that!!! 
wel...must run...duty calls....
Love you,
Sally

We here at DreamNet have big plans for April! We are all going to meet in Atlanta and hope that we will be able to meet some of the people who enjoy surfing our sites.
 Please e-mail me and let me know if you think you will be able to meet us.

 I hope that you had a wonderful Christmas!!!

A NEW WAY TO CAR JACK (NOT A JOKE)  Please keep this
circulating...
You walk across the parking lot, unlock your car, 
and get
inside.

      Then you start the engine and shift into REVERSE, and you look into the rearview mirror to back out of your parking space,

     and you notice a piece of paper stuck to the middle of the rear window So, you shift into PARK, unlock your doors and jump out of your car to remove that paper (or whatever it is) that is
obstructing your view.

   

      When you reach the back of your car, that is when the car-jackers appear out of nowhere, jump into your car and take off!
     
    Your engine was running and they practically mow you down as they speed off , And guess what ladies?  I bet your purse is still in the car...



BE  AWARE OF THIS NEW SCHEME THAT IS NOW  BEING 
USED.


   Just drive away and remove the paper that is stuck to your window later,and be thankful that you read this email.

I hope you  will forward this to friends and 
family...
especially
to

women!

   A purse contains all of your identification,

    and you certainly do NOT want someone getting your 
home
address.

    They already HAVE your  keys!

Lieutenant Tony  Bartolome, Bureau of  
Investigations

Florida Highway  Patrol, P.O. Box  593527, Orlando, 
FL
32859!

 So- I have to ask? Am I all alone or do any of you watch this kick- ass show? If so- who do YOU think the carver is?????
I found this site on the net here that gave you these three choices:

A. Kimber
B. Lizz
C. Christian

Thought some of my cooking buddies might like this.               



                  Double Layer Pumpkin Pie Recipe 
 
This recipe comes from the Kraft people. It sounded so good I just had to share.

 
4  ounces cream cheese, softened  
1  tablespoon milk or half-and-half  
1  tablespoon sugar  
1 1/2  cups thawed whipped topping (such as Cool Whip)  
1  prepared 9-inch graham cracker crumb crust  
1  cup cold milk or half-and-half  
1 (16  ounce) can pumpkin  
2 (3 1/2  ounce) packages vanilla flavor instant pudding and pie filling mix  
1  teaspoon ground cinnamon  
1/2  teaspoon ground ginger  
1/4  teaspoon ground cloves


  

   1. Mix cream cheese, 1 tablespoon milk and sugar in large bowl with wire whisk until smooth.        
   2. Gently stir in whipped topping. 
   3. Spread on bottom of crust. 
   4. Pour 1 cup cold milk into large bowl. 
   5. Add pumpkin, pudding mixes and spices. 
   6. Beat with wire whisk 2 minutes. 
   7. The mixture will be thick. 
   8. Spread over cream cheese layer.

 
   Refrigerate 4 hours or until set. 
   Garnish with additional whipped topping and chocolate-dipped pecan halves. 
   Store in the refrigerator until just before serving.

Hello.
 Please forgive me for not posting in so long. So much has been going on and even though I think about posting on here every day somehow I just never seem to make it in her to do it. 
 I think that most of you know tha I have a husband and three children. One soon -to-be- teenager, an elementary child, and a wee little toddler who keeps me on my toes from day light to dark.
 My husband gets a little sick sometimes, and his health is a little worse in the colder months for some reason. SO- things have been a little busy. I am sorry.
 I WILL post on here a lot more if you will just stick with me.
Well, Thanksgiving is coming up. Do you have plans? Family? Friends? Food?. Busy time of the year I know. I have already been cooking tonight and it is Sunday.
So- I am sure that you will all have the traditional Thanksgiving Dinner right?
I have something that may be a little different: if your family has a tradition or strange food that you all eat. Tell me about it. I'd love to find out a little about you!
Until tomorrow,
hugs and kisses

There was this man who lost one of his arms in an accident. He became 
very depressed because
he had loved to play guitar and a lot of things that took two arms.

One day he could not stand it anymore.  He decided to commit suicide. 
He got on an elevator and
went to the top of a tall building to jump off. He was standing on the 
ledge looking down and saw this man
on the sidewalk below skipping along and kicking up his heels.
He looked closer and noticed this man didn't have any arms at all

He started thinking, what am I doing up here feeling sorry for myself, 
I still have one good arm to do things with.
There goes a man with no arms skipping down the sidewalk happy and 
going on with his life.

He hurried down and caught the man with no arms. He told him how glad 
he was to see him because he had
lost one of his arms and felt ugly, useless and was going to kill 
himself.  He thanked him! again for saving his life
and he now knew he could make it with one arm if that guy could do it 
with no arms. The man with no arms began
dancing and whistling and kicking up his heels again.

He asked "Why are you so happy anyway?"

He said  "I'm NOT happy; my ass itches

Well, it looks like we have another hurricane headed this way. We normally just get some real strong winds and lots and lots of rain. Poor New Orleans is getting pounded again though.
 I just wanted to take a second and tell everyone that my thoughts and prayers are with all of those who may be affected by this one.

Subject: The Rooster

              John the farmer was in the fertilized egg business. He had several hundred young layers (hens), called pullets and eight or ten roosters,
              whose job was to fertilize the eggs.

             The farmer kept records and any rooster that didn't perform 
went into the soup pot and was replaced.
             That took an awful lot of his time so he bought a set of 
tiny bells and attached them to his roosters. Each bell had a different tone 
so John could tell from a distance, which rooster was performing.
 Now he could sit on the porch and fill out an efficiency report simply by 
listening to the bells.

             The farmer's favorite rooster was old Butch, a very fine 
specimen he was, too. But on this particular morning John noticed 
old Butch's bell hadn't rung at all!
            John went to investigate. The other roosters were chasing pullets,
             bells-a-ringing. The pullets, hearing the roosters coming, would run for cover.

           But to Farmer John's amazement, Butch had his bell in his beak, so it couldn't ring. He'd sneak up on a pullet, do his job and walk on to the
             next one.             
John was so proud of Butch, he entered him in the county fair and Butch
             became an overnight sensation among the judges. The result...
The judges not only awarded Butch the "No Bell Piece Prize" but 
they 
also awarded
            him the "Pulletsurprise" as well.

             Clearly Butch was a politician in the making. Who else but a politician could figure out how to win two of the most highly coveted 
awards on our planet by being the best at sneaking up on the populace 
and screwing them when they weren't paying attention?

A modern day cowboy has spent many days crossing the
> Texas plains without
> water. His horse has already died of thirst.
> 
> He's crawling through the sand, certain that he has
> breathed his last
> breath, when all of a sudden; he sees an object
> sticking out of the sand
> several yards ahead of him. He crawls to the
> object, pulls it out of the
> sand, and discovers what looks to be an old brief
> case. He opens it and out
> pops a genie. But this is no ordinary genie. She
> is wearing an IRS ID
> badge and a dull gray dress. There's a calculator
> in her pocketbook. She
> has a pencil tucked behind one ear.
> 
> "Well, cowboy," says the genie... "You know how I
> work. You have three
> wishes."
> 
> "I'm not falling for this." said the cowboy. "I'm
> not going to trust an IRS
> genie."
> 
> "What do you have to lose? You've got no
> transportation, and it looks like
> you're a goner anyway!"
> 
> The cowboy thinks about this for a minute, and
> decides that the genie is
> right.
> 
> "OK, I wish I were in a lush oasis with plenty of
> food and drink."
> 
> ***POOF***
> The cowboy finds himself in the most beautiful oasis
> he has ever seen. And
> he is surrounded with jugs of wine and platters of
> delicacies.
> 
> "OK, cowpoke, what's your second wish."
> 
> "My second wish is that I was rich beyond my wildest
> dreams."
> 
> ***POOF***
> The cowboy finds himself surrounded by treasure
> chests filled with rare gold
> coins and precious gems.
> 
> "OK, cowpuncher, you have just one more wish. 
> Better make it a good one!"
> 
> After thinking for a few minutes, the cowboy says...
> "I wish that no matter
> where I go, beautiful women will want and need me."
> 
> ***POOF***
> He turned into a tampon.
> 
> The moral of the story: If the government offers you
> anything, there's going
> to be a string attached.

This week has been pretty busy for me. I had a friend give birth to a beautiful baby boy, so we got to go see him tonight. We have had some pretty bad storms during the evenings, and tonight a huge oak tree lost a big limb, which fell right where I normally park my car! I had parked somewhere different thank goodness.
 We had a good time on my webcam which I had on Sunday this week. I am not sure just yet what day I will be on it next week, but, I will be that's for sure. I always have so much fun on there. Gosh we tell some awful jokes...
I hope everyone has a wondeful wondeful weekend. Stay Safe and Have Fun,
Sally

Yippee!! Friday is finally here! I plan on spending all day in the pool with my babies tomorrow, and making some pictures for you tomorrow evening. The weather is scorching here. The pool is the only place to be besides in the house...and I get tired of cleaning!
 Last week my husband got burned badly on his leg. He has 3rd degree burns from his knee to his ankle. He also burned his arm and eyebrow and eyelashes. Playing with gas and a brush pile again. I told him not to do it, and he did it as soon as I was out of the backyard !
 All is well though, and he is recovering. 
I want to take this opportunity to say thank you toall of you who keep in touch with me. I want you to know that I feel like I have actually made friends since I began here on DreamNet.Your friendships and kind words keep me motivated:)
 I hope you all have a wonderful wonderful weekend,
My Love,
Sweet Sally

Hello again.
 I want to say hello and sort of just tell you what has been going on with me the last few days. We are getting a pool and hot tub installed, and even though I am very happy about this, it has been sort of a time consuming project. LOl- we live in a small town and when the water dept hooked up the fire hose to the hydrant everyone and their brother had to stop and check things out! - love this little town I swear!
 Then yesterday I officially hurt my toe once again. I have broken it over and over, but had "stobbed it up" about four weeks ago, well, like I said I did it again!! 
 As you can see not much is going on, but, I still like to let you know what is happening with me. Looks like everyone knew the answer to the silly manhole cover question:) oh well- seemed good at the time:)
 This weeks quick pic was a request for someone who wanted a wet set. I am going to do you some outside shots this weekend and I am going to try to work myself up to doing some video clips for you too.You know how shy I am with that darned video camera!
 well- I will be in touch again and see if maybe I can catch anyone on the cam one evening too.
My Love To You,
Sweet Sally

Today is Saturday, I just wanted to say hi and wish you all a wonderful weekend. Looks like we have another hurricane on our hands. Emily this time. Is it headed towards any of you? If so my prayers are with you.
 I heard a silly question and want to know if you might know the answer:
Why are manhole cover round instead of square?
Silly question I know- but I would like to hear what you think:)
SweetSally

Not a lot is going on today. We do have a lot of yard work to catch up on due to the outerpart of hurricane Dennis. We didn't get any major damage, just some very very strong winds and a lo of rain.I thought i would see if I coud catch any of you on webcam tonight (smiles)

Dennis has slowed down a bit, but is giving us lots of rain and gusty winds. I hope that everyone is safe. I will be on-line tomorrow night for my webcam show as far as I can tell.
Sally
